text: The only reason why I am giving this store 2 stars because it's very nicely decorated. I came in due to a last minute cake pop run for a 3 year olds birthday party. In desperate need, we tried to get the price lowered just a tad bit like a dollar or two, but no budge. We proceeded to by a dozen expensive cake pops only to be disgustingly disappointed by the taste. The appearance was lovely, but the taste was the opposite. Very bland cake, no flavor! Even the coating was plain tasting. Way too expensive and not good enough.

OMG, if I could stop at this bakery everyday I would be the size of a barn!  You wonderfully, wicked enchantresses keep compelling me for more!! You all are on my to do list every VEGAS visit!!

Where do I begin? I started my journey w/ this bakery back in 2013 after my scouting trip for my Vegas wedding.

I am from NYC the land of the Cronut Dominique Ansel Bakery, The Cake Boss-Carlos Bakery, the one bite cupcake - Baked by Melissa, and the ever so famous Magnolias so my pallet is quite versed in all that is sweet and honestly I am a hard costumer to win since my standards are through the roof. 

I found GSS via pinterest. From a picture of the cake I had to have. I contacted the bakery via email. I was responded to promptly, friendly happy to serve from Ashley. Months of planning  and a BAZILLON emails from a bride who ordered a cake and desserts site and taste unseen. A good amount of my food expense was on my dessert table because 1) I swore of all cake and desserts until I had wedding cake and 2) east coaster like their Venetian table. "leave the gun, take the cannoli"

My wedding day 10/18/14...Besides of marrying my love the best thing about my day was the CAKE and Mini Pastries!!! The taste of my custom 3 tier  Buttery,  Moist, Stuffed with sweet yummy cannoli filling, cake was to DIE for! I ate the left over cake for the entire week for breakfast, lunch and dinner!! I couldn't ship it home so we ate it!! Then the mini lemon meringue pies, OMG AHHH-MAZING!!! The naked cakes all my 40 guests luved them and the edible chambord mousse cups EVERYTHING WAS DELICIOUS!! You gals must have wands cause you sure do bake up magic and I am for sure under your spell! Oh did I mention how beautiful it all was to boot!!

My Husband and I went back to Vegas on 3/5/15. I rented a car, drove out to the shop just to meet with wonderful Ashley and staff who had made my day so perfect. I also had a birthday cake made for my husband and indulged in a Thin Mint  & Manly Macaron. Again, I was NOT disappointed!!! The thin mint, can we talk about the ganche?? Soft , chewy and Oohh so minty goodness! BIGGER IS BETTER where I come from and Man this sucker is a two hander!!  Unfortunately I have to settle on my few trips a year to Vegas for these yummy delightful perfections of wonder. THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU for all the amazing sweets!

Okay, so I've been in to this bakery four times.  The first time was great and the cookies hit the spot.  The second and third times I went in the cashier was rude and the cookies were overdone. Today was the fourth visit.  There were no cookies and when I asked I was told, "not today." I had apparently interrupted the cashier and get friend's conversation. I don't care if the cookies were good.  I will never go to this place again.  Pretentious,  rude, and hit or miss on the treats. There are better places to go.

I am totally dissatisfied with the taste of my cake. I wasted 175.00 my dinner party for my daughter was ruined. No one like the cake. The cake was completely dry. Then lizie stated that their lemon cakes tend to be more dry. I wish I was informed of this prior to paying for my order. I would have never paid for a dry cake. I have this cake placed on my cake plate with a topper just to see if it would soften up...to no avail. The cream cheese was so heavy that the after taste...tasted like oil....I will not recommend this place to anyone do not waste your money...

The place is adorable! And they serve booze! Looks like a great place to hang out in the evenings. I wanted to love everything about this place, but the cupcakes were dry...super disappointing.  I'll be back to give them a second chance, though...

Any bakery that is by appointment only should not have a huge marquee and have posted on there doors that it is appointment only.  And then when you walk in look around confuse a man with a box of raw meat shouldn't treat you like a hobo looking for a place to squat

Love this place! The deserts are absolutely beautiful and very delicious. They are a little too sweet for me but I always have a few bites and save the rest for a later snack. It's the perfect place to grab and espresso or champagne and a dessert to start the evening. I have never tasted their wedding cakes but they are some of the most beautiful I have ever seen I love looking at their Instagram as well!

Here is yet another bakery that is not a place that you can stop by and purchase cupcakes or sweets on your way home from work or on your way to a party. 

The info listed on Yelp is misleading because although it gives business hours, they are not open to the public! 

I am looking for some cupcakes so I drove in my car to this location and there was a cute handmade sign on the door that said "By Appointment Only". While in the parking lot I called the phone number and somebody answered, but they said sorry not open to the public. Must make an appointment and place an order!  So annoying especially based on reviews! 

I give one star because of misleading yelp info. They need to specify by appointment only. Call ahead no matter where you go. Ask lots of questions.

If I could give no stars, I would. In the beginning, there was a lot of confusion and miscommunication. Our caterer for our wedding was paying for our cake but they told gimme some sugar to give me whatever I wanted, no matter the price. Those were his exact words. Well at our tasting we agreed on a certain size cake. Good thing I sent an email just confirming things because gimme some sugar took it upon themselves to downgrade my cake to a smaller size because they felt I didn't need the size I wanted. Then they tried to play it off as if our caterer was the one that decided this, which was completely untrue. But whatever, I put that aside because I was very excited for them to make my cake. Well then comes my wedding day. The cake looks nothing like the picture I gave them. They assured me they could do what I wanted, but it looked like a cheap effort on their part. Then we cut into the cake, and SURPRISE, there was not one flavor that I picked!! I ended up going with red velvet and strawberry shortcake. Want to know what I actually got?! Pumpkin spice and lemon raspberry!!! Hmm interesting. Also, I have a severe nut allergy so what if one of the flavors they put in my cake that I didn't pick, had nuts in it? Clearly they didn't care!! I don't understand how a so called "top rated" bakery can mess up so royally!! Needless to say I will never be doing business with them again. And I will be sure to warn others. I know they make celebrity cakes, so maybe I just wasn't high profile enough? Well thank you gimme some sugar, for completely ruining my wedding cake! And another shocker, no response from gimme some sugar yet as to my dissatisfaction. They apologized to our caterer first, because you know, it was only OUR wedding. Basically they made up a bunch of excuses to cover their tracks. The only problem was their excuses didn't make sense, and when I came back with evidence that they were making things up to make themselves look better, they didn't really have anything to say.

If you have something planned, this is a great place to go.  If you have a sweet tooth and just want to drop in for a quick treat, expect to be treated like trash and only given a VERY limited selection.  The place is good, well decorated, but customer service is lacking!

I emailed this letter to Gimme Some Sugar LV regarding my daughter's wedding cake. The owner responded about 45 minutes later stating that she delivered the cake and she left a brown cardboard box. She said they don't provide 4 inch boxes for the top tier cake...which her employees said they did provide a box for the top tier when we ordered. She said they have never had a problem with anyone cutting the cake. I feel like her phone call was argumentative and demeaning with a nasty demeanor. Shame on you!

To: Gimme Some Cake

On June 25, I came to your store to order a wedding cake. We told your employee that we wanted bling on the cake as well as ombre color. We pointed out the particular cake sample on your wall shelf that had a bling band around the bottom of the layers. More importantly, we requested the cake to be only two layers simply because we knew that a 3 layer cake for twenty people would look meager. We also informed your employee that took the order that we would need a special box delivered with the cake for the top layer because the bride would be carrying the top layer back to Atlanta on the airplane. Not to mention we needed a box to carry the cake out of the restaurant. Your employee assured us that you could provide us with the box. We were told by the restaurant where you delivered the cake that no box was provided when it was delivered. We are extremely disappointed with the lack of understanding and care for our order.

As cake professionals surely you would know that the scale of this cake would make it impossible to cut whole pieces for the traditional and treasured cake cutting wedding pictures. Our formal wedding cake knife and a regular knife did not have enough of an edge to properly cut, making  a complete mess of the cake cutting process. I have an attached of the image of your cake and you will notice that the cake was not properly designed for a wedding. 

I am aware that our order form clearly states 3 layers but we ask for two layers. As cake professionals you should know that that a 6" 5" 4" cake would make it impossible to cut whole pieces. We had a $300 cake disaster to say the least. I feel that as a cake designer it is your duty to properly advise and design cakes appropriate for each unique occasion. Our cake was poorly designed and we were ill advised by your staff for our once in a lifetime occasion.
We are painfully disappointed with your service.

Hi Ashley, 
   Thank you for your response. During the day our experience has been fine. I think your night crew is not as polished. As I said, Gimme Sugar has excellent macaroons! We may be back. We will go during the day though when your service is better :-).

Thank you, 
Austin Gold

If I could give them 10 stars, I would!

Every cake, cookie, and dessert is made with such creativity, originality and specified for each individual who orders to their desire. The quality is outstanding, not with only how it looks (which is gorgeous) but with the taste!!! 

I have tried many wedding cakes, I recently planned my wedding, and not only were most cakes dry, but the flavor was so artificial. 

Gimme Some Sugar's cakes are INCREDIBLE! They are moist and absolutely delicious! The flavor is so rich and delectable. 

It may be difficult to take a bite because it looks so amazing, but their cakes and desserts taste just as great as they look! You will not be disappointed!

Went here for a girls night, so cute! Quite a lot of traffic for a little place (because its worth it) and open late! Loved the atmosphere with the chandelier's and cute chairs, reasonably priced desserts and so delicious! You've got to try the Nutella macaroons!

all i have to say is this place looks at people differently then big accounts. be careful i was given the run around until they turned around and said that they couldn't fulfill my order. very lack azeick and will not go out of their way to make the customer happy. they are in the lets make sweet and sweet are suppose to put smiles on our faces. i walked out of there with nothing no sweets or anything for that matter. pissed off at every single person. they will drop the ball if they choose so. not the way to run a business. SERVICE IS THE WORST FROM FRONT TO BACK!!!

 this will make for a negative PLUS posting.

I was very disappointed with my order! First I think they are WAY to expensive (luckily I had a Groupon for them so I only ended up spending $30 even though my order cost $54). I ordered 2 dozen cake pops for my daughters' birthdays. On their website the pops are cylindrical in shape, when I receives mine they were round (like the ones they advertise on tv. Ones I could have baked myself and saved money). Some of them did not have icing (which I think was white chocolate) covering all of it. The cake didn't seem to be cooked all the way, instead of being light & fluffy it was very dense. 
I'm not sure why I got such a shotty deal b/c I noticed they had a lot of great reviews.
The only thing I'll give them is we had no conflicts, they were pleasant to deal with (which was through email)
Walking in feels like Alice in wonderland haha but nice little place. The manger is very friendly and treats are delicious.

I finally was able to try this place out, and it was amazing. Their desserts are fresh, and uniquely tasty. The macarons are soft, chewy and melt in your mouth. My favorite was the fruit eclair (I think that's what it was), it was delicious and fresh. I also had their coffee. Downside was their cappuccino small size was like an espresso (it was really strong too), recommend getting the large if you want more in your cup. Other than that it was good coffee. 
Sucks they're so far out (I live in Summerlin), if not I'd be there all the time.

I gave one star and it was generous. I was in talking to the front girl about their treats, since I saw them off the highway; and a lady (I'm guessing was the owner) came out and made the girl helping me talk to someone in the phone for a "huge" order. I'm guessing my couple of desserts wasn't important enough. Not to mention they aren't worth the time going in and getting. The cake part was dry and not very flavorful. Not a place I would go back. Rude service and not very good.

I am an admitted treat addict and with Gimme Some Sugar's late hours, delicious treats, and weekly changes to the offerings - I cannot stay away. Luckily, I have an understanding husband and friends that enjoy sitting in the shop with a sweet treat and a craft beer or coffee. 

My absolute favorite is the fig and goat cheese {oversized} macaroon. When I had tried macaroons previously, I thought they were a bit overrated - a fad that just wasn't for me. Then...my world was rocked. The macaroon was the perfect balance of hard outer shell, soft, moist interior and the heavenly filling of the goat cheese and fig compote. AMAZING. My husband enjoys their cheesecakes, blondies, and weekly specialties. 

Since my first taste, I have been a weekly customer. Usually choosing a new flavor of macaroon and always the fig and goat cheese (thankfully, that is a regular flavor.) You cannot go wrong with Gimme Some Sugar. 

Go in - get a treat (or two), sip a coffee, and enjoy the beautiful display of amazing cakes. These girls are so talented - you will be a regular too.

This is one of those places that is jut on a whole new level compared to the competition. The cakes they put out are almost too pretty too eat! and yes they are as delicious as they are beautiful. The designs for the cakes are amazing. just look at there portfolio. We had a suit case cake made and it looked like i could just open it up and pack. Sooooo realistic. The cake pops and all the little small goodies they make are equally if not more delicious than the cake. If there was a 6th star; i would give it to them

Me and the fam were excited to try it w so many great reviews. It's a fancy place, it didn't feel like a bakery to me. I guess it's because their main focus are cakes. 

What we got:
Monster Cookie- It sounded good when she explained it to me, m&m's with PB and oatmeal w chocolate chips. (I know what was I thinking?) I took one bite and couldn't finish. Super dense and sweet w way too much PB

Choc/chip Macaroon - my kid got this, she didn't want to finish it which says a lot since she loves sweets. Me and my mom couldn't believe how sweet and gooey it was. No thanks.  Smaller macaroons would probably have a better texture & be more enjoyable....just my opinion.

Choc/Coconut frosted Cupcake - Kinda dry & the icing tasted artificial. I prefer Cupcakery or sprinkles at the linq no doubt.

No desire to go back for any baked goods they have. :/

Gimme Some Sugar made our groom's cake for us. All I had was a picture of a baby shower cake that was the source of my idea, and Gimme Some Sugar just ran with it. They did an AWESOME job. My husband LOVED it. And not only did the cake look good, it tasted good. Very moist with a lot of flavor. The person who took my order gave me some suggestions that were different from mine, and I took her advice. I'm glad I did. A great bakery.

I ordered a 30th birthday cake for my girlfriend. It was really nerve wracking ordering a cake via email, but Ashley made the ordering process seamless. She answered all of my endless questions, offered suggestions, and eased my concerns. But about the cake...it was more than the birthday girl and I expected and warranted its own photo shoot from the invited guests. It was a Las Vegas 30th birthday themed cake complete with the sign, dice, poker chips, and a silver "30" the size of the cake! The best part is that it tasted as good as it looked. It tasted so good that the birthday girl brought the remaining cake back to NYC on the plane. THANK YOU to all whom had a hand in making her cake. It added so very much to the weekend.

Ordered my baby shower cake and goodies for a dessert bar from GSS. Let me just start by saying how blown away I was with how gorgeous my cake turned out. Kristen helped turn my vision into something even more beautiful then I could have imagined. It made for a beautiful centerpiece for the party. We also ordered a few dozen s'mores macs, chocolate chip cookies (my FAV!), and frosted sugar cookies shaped like blue bow ties. I only wish I had hid a few macs for myself for after the party because those went so quickly! 
If you haven't been to their location, you need to check it out. It's super cute, and a perfect place for date night. I can't wait to go in and enjoy a glass of champagne and one of their yummy desserts after this baby comes.

The customer service at this bakery is horrendous. I ordered a plain white cake for a party noting when I ordered it that I would be storing it over night and serving it the next day. When I went to pick up my cake, it was not plain white as requested but instead covered in chocolate drizzle and lumps. I was told by the ladies working that I could "just scrape it off with a knife." They didn't even offer to help fix it. The box they wanted me to take the cake home in also didn't fit the size of cake I ordered, and wouldn't come close to closing shut. I was told it costs extra for a box that will actually close... What?!?!? Buyer beware.

My God. Those are damn good macaroons. 

I stopped here today to see what Gimme Some Sugar had and I just couldn't stop myself from buying 4...but was told if I bought 6, I'd get $0.50 off each macaroon. OK! - I'll take 6 then. AND I got a dollar off for visiting the first time and checking in on Yelp. - Thanks Yelp!  

$21 later I'm driving home and wondering how I'm going to eat all these ginormous King Kong sized macaroons... 

I'm going to try my best, dammit!

I have been coming here since they opened.  The staff is always nice and professional.  This place is my go to place for sugar fix and get awat. The decor is so beautiful and I really enjoy hanging out and enjoying my sugar. The staff takes time with each customer, never any pressure. They remember you and really go out of their way to make you feel welcomed. Every time I get company from out of town, I take them there. 

I workout hard and go here for my cheat day. I look forward to the different goodness they create. My favorite thing to order. .. hum.. all of it. There is nothing they bake that I don't like. 

I love gimme some sugar.

Holy macaron!

This place serves up some seriously decadent macarons.  Bacon maple, birthday cake, goat cheese and fig, nutella and, my favorite, peppermint candy cane, are just some of the fancy flavors they have in stock.  And, they are HUGE, especially the peppermint candy cane.  It will take you several sittings to devour it.  And, it's delicious, if a tad too sweet.  Prices for these run from $3.50 to $4.50.

Also, other genius things about this place are: (1) it serves alcohol; and (2) It's open late.  Like, 11 p.m. late.   

I'll definitely go back to try more macarons, their moose domes, and cakes.  Everything looked amazing.
One of my favorite places for sweets!!!  If you haven't tried this place you're missing out.  Macaroons are AMAZING!

We were headed back from our trip to Boulder City and made sure to put this place and another bakery down the street on our list to stop at. As we all know, my appetite for baked goods has me on the constant lookout for new places. I might have a problem, I don't know.

If I can be honest, this bakery made no sense to me. I guess they are known for their fancy cakes, but when I walked in, they had a bunch of desserts. One section was higher priced fancier looking things and then another case had cupcakes and macarons and such. Then they also serve coffee. On top of that, they had croissants and scones. 

My advice would be to do what you're good at, which appears to be high end cakes. 

I tried a scone that was cheddar and bacon and chive because nothing looked that tempting to me as far as sweets. I will say, the flavor was good and it was nice to see a place that offered a couple savory items. Compared to the scones I have had, I didn't think the texture was quite right. Flavor. Good. Texture. Off.

My friend tried a croissant and honestly, it tasted like a decent grocery store croissant. It wasn't bad, but as I am about to get to, there is a place two blocks away that makes the best croissant I've ever tasted. These were a good try but they seemed to lack the right flakiness. 

Like I said, it appears that they make beautiful artwork when it comes to their cakes, but it felt like their retail items are just them trying to be everything to everyone.

I ordered a cake and desserts for my birthday from here and everything was beyond perfect! I frequent this bakery for any friends or family's birthdays and celebrations as I have never been disappointed. The staff is always very friendly and helpful. When choosing my desserts they helped me decide how many to order and suggested a wide variety. My guests all loved everything so much. Now onto the cake.... I had 2 tiers. A layer of s'mores and a layer of Luscious lemonberry! I had to eat 1 of each because everyone kept raving about how moist and delicious they were! And hey.... Calories don't count on your birthday right?? : ) the staff here are true artists. I would have never imagined my cake to be so beautiful. They got it perfect. Thank you Gimme Some Sugar!

The most perfectly delectable macaroons I've ever tasted! The flavor a are amazing! My favorite, for now, strawberry lemonade! Their regular cookies are also delicious and the staff are extremely welcoming and helpful!

You will NOT be disappointed by Gimme Some Sugar! You can tell by all the pictures how talented they are and how amazing the cakes look (you almost don't want to eat them!) but what you wouldn't believe is how great they taste! I have ordered 3 cakes from GSS the first being for my husbands 30th bday. He is not a cake fan but I knew he would be blown away from the look of the cake so I got one for him anyway. When I talked to Kristen she said they had a pumpkin pie cake and I knew I had to try it as it is my husband's favorite pie. He LOVED it and actually ate two pieces! All 3 cakes we have got from them were perfect and all of them amazed everyone who saw them! Could not give GSS enough compliments!

Everything up to the point of my wedding went well.... the ladies are very on top of the whole ordering process and very nice to deal with. I wouldn't have even written a review except I feel like they could have been a little more apologetic  about delivering my wedding cupcakes late to my reception. I had all my guests sitting watching the assembly of my cupcake tower when they were to be delivered an hour before the reception was set to start. Then I get an email notifying me that I was late making final payment but since they neglected to call me to ask for payment they were going to wave any and all late charges.... Um, if GSS had called me right after my wedding I would have paid the balance in full so I really didn't understand the email letting me know how kind they were to wave late charges that would have been their issue to begin with since they neglected to phone me to get the balance after services were rendered. It was kind of like they wanted to write me and tell me how kind they were waving the late charges when it was their fault for not calling me sooner. When I emailed them back explaining that I was disappointed with how late the cupcakes were delivered all I got was a "sorry".... "please call us as soon as possible and make final payment".... not what I expected. Cupcakes were cute and tasted pretty good, from what I was able to taste.... a little pricey but that's the trend I guess. I was disappointed in their lack of remorse over the late delivery and their annoying email about neglecting to call me for payment, I think I should have at least received some kind of a peace offering.

I can't believe I've never been to this shopping center before! I decided to stop by Gimme Some Sugar. It was a cute place, and the desserts looked good. I got their gluten-free brownie, and although it was very sweet, it was fairly good. I wanted to get some other things, but they had mainly unusual flavors/ingredients. I still like the basics, such as chocolate, vanilla, strawberry, raspberry, etc. and don't like things like bacon, Nutella and other things thrown into the mix. I do get that people are into these unusual flavors these days, but why not still have some standard flavors available, especially chocolate! The brownies were the only completely chocolate items there, and I was hoping to get a chocolate macaroon since the first and last time I had one was in Paris. I'll never forget it! The place was very clean, and the person at the front was great and happy to help you decide on a dessert.

This place deserves 5 stars just for the macaroons! They are amazing and I've tried almost every flavor. However the 3 stars is because their cupcakes and cake are pretty awful. Dry, bland and just not good. I expected a lot more from a bakery that specializes in cakes. I see from other reviews that this is a common theme, disappointment in the dry and flavorless cake so I would hope they would take note and make some changes. The speciality desserts are hit and miss. Some are really yummy and some are not so good. The sugar cookies are great, but the vegan cookies are extremely chewy and not the best vegan cookie I've ever had. Unlike most of the other reviews, I haven't ever really had a problem with the staff.

Love the kitsch aspect of the store. Very trendy and fashion-forward. Their sweets are good though, but not as "gourmet" as they represent. I found their tiramisu cup really dry and I wish they'd make their desserts more traditional rather than have be like every one else with fondants and fusion. Don't get me wrong, their Caramel Apples are perfect.

IF I could give this place a ZERO rating I would.  In May I ordered a birthday cake for my 1 year old daughter. It was a really good cake and nothing was wrong with it. Everything went according to plan. It was a little bit overpriced but it was cute so I don't care.

The next month in June however was a totally different  story. It was my son's 5th birthday this time and since I liked the cake I was hoping to get another cake from them for his 5th birthday. I place an order over the phone for June 24th it was on a Wednesday. (my son loves Spiderman so I ordered him a Spiderman cake)

 The lady who took my order which I don't know her name confirmed everything with me and told me it will be ready in the morning of June 24th. My husband goes there that morning and they told him that the cake won't be ready till Friday. Which I don't understand because I ordered it for Wednesday. 

The lady in charge told me there must have been a miscommunication, that i gave her the wrong date..... (because you know i dont know my sons birthday....) and said nothing else. She was actually quite rude about it while I was on the phone with her she was taking orders from other people who were in line at her store and put me on hold four times.

When it was convenient for her to actually talk to me the only thing that she could offer me was either a refund or only 10 percent off on some cupcakes. 

I was devastated because this was my 5 year old son's birthday and I didn't want him to not have a cake. I asked her about the cupcakes and if we could make them spiderman themed with some fondant cutouts or something and she told me that she could only do basic cupcakes a regular vanilla cupcake with some red and blue frosting... 

I couldn't believe it first you make the mistake of putting the wrong date on my order and then you're going to offer me only 10 percent off for some basic cupcakes and won't even take the time to add a couple of fondant cut outs or something to make them more Spiderman themed?

I said screw it and ask for a refund and the refund didn't even come to me until a WEEK later so let's say for example if I didn't have the money to get another cake my son would have not had a birthday cake. This is the worst customer service I've ever had with ANY store. I will be sure to never come to the store again. 

And I will never recommend this bakery to anybody. In fact I make sure to tell people my experience with this bakery.
I just moved into this area. This cute hidden gem is a great place to catch coffee and a quick desert!!  Brenda was awesome and very personable!!! hours are great too!!! Try it out!!

The best cake designers in town!  These girls can create anything!  I've ordered from them several times and am always amazed by the outcome.  They created an Alice in Wonderland themed wedding cake to accompany wine for my blog post, "What wine pairs with wedding cake?" on my blog QuitWINEing.com.  It was incredible, in addition to being light and tasty.  Check these ladies out, you won't be disappointed!

Gimme Some Sugar does it all!

My fiance and I had our first experience with GSS for our wedding cake tasting. We met with Ashley and she was a delight. She was so upbeat and genuine. She seemed as excited as we were. She had some great selections for us and was oepn to each of our ideas. The cakes themself are just amazing, They are light and the fillings are delicious. You can tell that Ashley and Kristen love what they do. 

The Mrs. then surprised me with my very own themed birthday cake!! It looked amazing and tasted twice as good as the design came out. Our group of people were astonished at how good it was. We ate the entire thing! The wedding is two months away now and we cannot wait to see how our cake is going to look, we already know how great it is going to taste. 

Being that my fiance and I live in Henderson and had such a wonderful experience with them for the tasting we were anxious to find out that they were opening The Bake Shoppe. This meant that we could get our hands on their treats ANYTIME WE WANTED!

They have put together one of our favorite late night hang outs. The Mrs. goes there for the wine and i can't get enough of their Macarons. They have mastered the art of making them. We drop by every time we see that they have come out with a new combination and we truly enjoy stopping by after a great dinner. We don't even bother with ordering desserts from whatever restaurant we ate at!

They have a great set up. The music, the environment, the drinks and desserts. I am love this place and love them! 

Gimme Some Sugar is a must for everyone!
They had good sweets. Kind of expensive.  Went here with my girlfriend and she got the giant macrons and I had some and it was super sweet

Got a creamy good gift for Christmas and have been hooked ever since! Try it all! They lose a star for location..... Right next to a GYM really?! So now I have to feel shamed every time.... Oh well. Worth it!

We love these guys so much that we have all our Henderson client meeting at their shop. 
Everything I've tried is delicious.

Not super impressed. The selection in store no where near matched what I saw here on Yelp. I came in late afternoon on a Saturday. Maybe the inventory was low, who knows. I got the peanut butter blonde which was good but I was not happy with the 12oz cappuccino I ordered. It was super tiny, like just a shot. I asked the lady if it was only supposed to fill up half the cup & she said yes, it's espresso with foam. Okay I understand that but if I'm paying $3.25 for 12oz, I want 12oz. The way it's made shouldn't have anything to do with the quantity, right?

Every time I bring my family to Gimme Some Sugar it is the biggest treat! The desserts are amazingly delicious and always beautiful - like ART beautiful. 

While we got married long before these amazing ladies were in business - and so we did not have the opportunity to delight my guests with one of their jaw-droppingly creative custom cakes - I've seen them in magazines, at parties, at celebrity birthday bashes on my Instagram feed, and gracing the walls of their fashionably designed cafe in Henderson. 

And I am not exaggerating when I say that these ladies are artists. They truly are infinitely creative sculptors who create unique, meaningful, centerpiece cakes for their custom cake clients.

They really are top-shelf, the very best you can hope for.

Did I mention, they're also wonderfully giving and charitable? I once asked the ladies if they could help our Boy Scout Troop in its annual Christmas donation to St. Judes For Children out in Boulder City. St. Judes takes in children and moms who are fleeing domestic violence environments - they are all saints out there. We were hoping for a few cupcakes or cake pops or something. Instead, the Gimme Some Sugar ladies baked a tear-jerkingly gorgeous custom Christmas cake. The kids and moms and the whole Scout Troop were floored by their generosity and creativity.

If you're looking for excellence, and stunningly talented creativity in your custom cakes and baked delicacies, ya gotta go with Gimme Some Sugar.
Love this place! They have amazing macaroons in a variety of fun flavors. This time I tired something new, a Peanut Butter Chocolate and Bananna Cheesecake! Absolute Heaven in your mouth.

SOOOOOO PRETTY! 
   Really a gr8 find in Henderson just off the freeway @ the Stephanie exit. 
   All different type of treats, cookies, HUGH macaroons in many assorted flavors, savory scones, sweet scones, tropical flavored delicacies, chocolate desserts! REALLY!!! even sugar free & gluten free options.
    The black & white walls with nicely showcased cakes samples, comfortable chairs, spectacular lighting....as u can tell I 'd the space. 
    Open till midnight PLUS they offer champagne, wine & beer along with coffee, lattes, cappuccinos .
    All the servers which we had were sooo polite, helpful couldn't have been any more pleasant especially the gal who took our order & made our coffees. The ONLY I might recommend would be to serve coffee drinks in actual cups opposed to TO GO cups~ however that is a minor, very minor issue for me.

All sugar, no flavor. Tried this place out about a month ago. Quaint decor, nice ambiance. Ordered a snickers and pumpkin macaroon. We each took one bite and literally left. It was all sugar. Disappointing.
Great place if your craving great coffee and good deserts

I am such a fan of this bakery! When ever friends come to visit it's a must I bring them by to try their Macaron's they have such out of the box types of deserts which makes them so refreshing. I love going around girl scout cookie times they buy a bunch of boxes them make macaron flavors based on the cookies, the caramel delights are my favorite and a must try. If your a fan of nutella oh they have macaron's with that flavor as well. This place is such high quality with reasonable prices. the macaron's are huge too! I always grab a few cupcakes and cookies for the kids when i stop in and they love them. The bakery is very nicely decorated and always clean. The dark haired lady that works in there everytime ive been in there is friendly and always tell you to let her know if you have any questions. I would recomend them to anyone who is looking for great deserts to take out or eat in. I wish my daughter was still little this would be a place i would take her to for a tea party!!

Not only is this a bakery that you can stop in and pick up item to go but you can dine in. They are open late for a bakery and that's because this is a popular little spot to have a glass of wine and dessert with your friends. 

Strawberry cheesecake- very pretty and yummy. When you first bite into it, it tastes like strawberry ice cream. The crust has very strong taste and is delicious. I like that you taste more strawberries than just regular cheesecake with a couple strawberries on top. 

Confetti cupcake- looks more like a homemade cupcake then the fancy cupcakes you would find in another bakery but I was disappointed. I think homemade cupcakes are the best and always super moist. This one was the opposite. Dry and the frosting didn't have much flavor.

Brownie- delicious! Extremely rich so you can easily share. My favorite item there. 

Sugar cookie with frosting- I have to say, it's the best sugar cookie I've found in Vegas. (Trust me, I'm picky!) it's not super soft like the ones you buy in the grocery store and it's ten times better.

I never thought of myself as being "spoiled"  living in LA, but finding amazing food has been quite the challenge since I've been staying here in Henderson. While trying to replace my fantastic baker in Whittier i found this Trendy desert bar looking place that almost looked out of place in its strip mall (should prob be on the strip). the girl working there was nice, super helpful, knowledgeable about the place and the stuff in it, so 2 stars for that. The macaroons were great so a star for that, and 1 star because I'm eager to come back. I didnt get to try the cupcakes since they have different types daily and they had some weird ones today(vegan, peanut something, something else fancy).

Definitely must have a super-sweet tooth to really enjoy the sugary sweet confections here at Gimme Some Sugar...hockey puck sized macarons ( I apologize, I called them macaroons in another review...it's not those coconut cookie thingys, they're the meringue type cookie thingys)

I tried the Manly Macaron ( had me at bacon in the description...), it was really  good. More sweet than savory (more bacon, please), smoky, crunchy, caramely goodness. There was a hint of alcohol in the cream (bourbon?), like I said, didn't read the ingredients past bacon...

Okay, the giant macarons are on-point, but maybe bring your insulin (just in case...). If macarons aren't your thing, they have a whole array of delicious looking cookies, brownies, cupcakes and other single serve desert items on display (no, really, they all look good...cue Homer Simpson in Candyland). As if that wasn't enough, they serve alcohol! So, get your sweet on and get your drink on.

Put simply - our wedding cake was stunningly beautiful and absolutely delicious. Gimme Some Sugar was such a pleasure to work with in every way possible. We'd highly recommend them to anyone and everyone, especially the discerning/type-A/particular bride.
Bomb macaroons!!!! So many different flavor options to pick from....my fav was the cookie butter macaroon!!! Definitely a place to check out....a lot of cute desserts.

A bakery that also serves alcohol? I'm in trouble! This place has all your favorite vices: indulgent sweets, quality wines, and even savory scones. If you have a crack habit, I'm pretty sure it's baked into the delicate, double-layer fruit Pavlova. 

This is also the only place you'll find macarons the size of your palm- higher price, lessened opportunity to try multiple styles, but the flavors are spot-on! The popular ginger-fig has been a bit elusive, but the strawberry-lemonade has ample, balanced notes of each, plus a smear of jam in the middle. 

Everything in the cases looks like a work of art. On the downside, they're priced like art, too- $5.25/macaron, $7 for that tiny but tasty Pavlova. Great spot for a special occasion, like a Girls Night Out or a birthday meetup with friends, but not an easy spot to visit regularly.

I think the name of their shop is my catch phrase!  It's also my new favorite place for a treat!

We stopped in one evening to fulfill my sweet tooth.   We walked into a contemporary designed shop that is right up my alley.   Beautiful with pops of color from their towering cake designs.   

We were helped by an amazing lady with eagerness and personality beyond compare.  She informed us about this wonderful little shop with tidbits about their items.   We decided on the vanilla bean cheesecake and tiramisu.  I didn't plan on getting a macaron because here's the kicker...  I've never had one before.  Crazy?  Yes, I must have been.  Upon mentioning this to her she threw in one for free for me to try.  How nice is that?! 

We didn't stay there to eat our treats but rushed home to try them all.  Insanely great is all I can say about the macaron.  Being a macaron virgin, I can't compare it to anyone else.  I will say it was one of the best desserts I had ever had.   The light and airiness that surrounded the filling touched every taste bud with extreme delight!

As for the other desserts, fabulous as well.  They went way above the competition.  The cheesecake was creamy with the vanilla bean infused flavor.  Yum.  Tiramisu is another favorite treat of mine that they have also perfected.  They have their mastered their craft here.

With the utmost top customer service, clean contemporary shop and fabulous desserts, I just don't know if it can get any better than this.

Notice on door says locks are changed due to delinquent payment.  Dated 5/9 which would put it the day I was last in here. Either Im a glutton for punishment trying all the artificial stuff or I really wanted to have this place succeed with new owners. I asked if there was anyone making cakes on premises, reply was " it's done at industrial?" Last visit stuff in case looked stale, banana filling brown on one cake, I got a stale cronut..thought I would give them one more try... but oh well! 


Too bad and sad and annoyed for the new owners who took over this place. No further comment.. 

Anyways if you like coffee, they have it at Mothership Coffee Roasters. 

The breads according to Majesty Bakeries website, you can find it at COSTCO or WinCo. 

For macarons, check out the new sweets place in town, Sweets 507/Michelle by Sweets 507

Looking for the awesome cakes and GSS creations? Look up Kristen the former owner and Cake artist over at Masterpiece Cake Studio on Water Street here in Henderson.. she's still rockin out awesome cakes  check her IG account.

European buttercream...

My very first job was at a German bakery in Costa Mesa CA & during that experience I gained a lot of weight and learned all about the finest ingredients around. I'm a super snob when it comes to bakeries & how could you not be after being around the best. 

This place is really chic & looked like it belonged at The Cosmo. We came in late so decided to take a few things to go. I can't resist a good looking vanilla cupcake & my man settled on a brownie. The very nice owner looked at how tall he was & gave him a free brownie as well. Before we walked out the owner also told us to pick out any bread we wanted on the house after learning it was our first visit. How nice!

Big shout out to the owner Velvet who was super sweet and a Miami hottie. I couldn't wait to dig into my cupcake and the buttercream was just the way I remembered it to be...divine! I am definitely down to drive across town for anything this good...

I also fell in love with the contemporary chandeliers and am going to get my own for my closet. Brownie was good but didn't blow me away and I did try the bread which was awesome as well & perfect for any type of sandwich.
Such a fun place. Tried a brownie and a snickerdoodle. Super yummy. Can't wait to come back on a date night. Craft beer and wine pairings with fancy desserts? Yes please!

I was introduced to macarons by a work friend and my sweet tooth was craving them badly. A quick search on yelp showed me this place with highest reviews, so I went. Its located on Stephanie and 215, and it could be hard to find. Just look for a laser tag and miniature golf plaza and its located on the right side.

I got three different things; two fig and goat cheese macaron, one mint and chocolate and one snicker doodle cupcake (see pics). All of them were delicious, specially the fig & goat cheese macaron. The cupcake was moist and the frosting just melted in my mouth. I would highly recommend checking out this place if you are craving something sweet.

A shout out to this wonderful baker for making cupcakes for our fifth grade promotional ceremony at Estes Mcdoniel.  If you haven't tried this place not only are all the sweats delicious the atmosphere is gorgeous!

Let me start off by saying I am a BIG fan of sweets. Like, I've developed type 2 diabetes kind of sweet tooth; seriously I now have type 2 diabetes.  Gimme Some Sugar is one of my favorite spots to go for something sweet. They have a varied selection but seem to focus on their variety of macaroons. Also serving up cookies, cake pops, marshmallow bars, cupcakes as well as your higher end (fancy) types of pastries & custom cakes. 
Everything I have had here was good but I typically get a macaroon. They have several that are standard flavors that they keep year around but they also have a few that they change regularly so there is something new to try.  They make caramel in house and it is pretty freaking amazing, so I would recommend that to anyone who was visiting for the first time.  As for the cookies, cupcakes and cake pops, they are well made and tasty but how much can I elaborate on that?

I should also mention that this establishment is creative. They serve wine, beer, (I think, beer) have an espresso machine and some tea sachets.  You can sign up for events to decorate pastries with friends while drinking wine and enjoying each others company. I come here for the dessert since I'm not a huge drinker and I am not a big fan of their coffee.  
To sum it up, this is a cozy, well decorated place to come with friends and enjoy dessert together. I come for the macaroons mostly and I stay because it's a relaxing environment with a friendly staff. Definitely check it out if you're looking for a late night sugar fix.

Boyfriend brought a box of assorted goodies home but everything seemed to taste the same and I guess it was too sugary and you couldn't tell the difference between each dessert since the sugar overpowered the flavors

I hate to be writing such a poor review, but I would just like to share the experience I went through at my wedding. My new husband and I got married this past Saturday at a spectacular venue called Dragon Ridge in Henderson. Everything was wonderful except for my wedding cake, which was ordered at Gimme Some Sugar.

Our cake came with our wedding package and we are in no way shape or form blaming Dragon Ridge for our cake. We had a tasting at GSS prior to the wedding and the cakes that they let us sample were very dry. My wedding planner was very clear about requesting a MOIST cake for the day of the wedding and even asked the staff member to highlight that we would like a MOIST cake in their notes. 

On our wedding day the cake was very beautiful but during our cake cutting ceremony, the tiny bite I tried was very DRY. I asked my guests to be honest with me about the cake and they told me it was DRY! My wedding planner even felt the cake in her hands and it was so DRY that it crumbled to pieces! 

This was very disappointing and what could have been a perfect and gorgeous wedding even better was if we could have had a good tasting cake. This was very embarrassing to me because my brother mentioned in his speech to me that I was the best dessert chooser and that I know my sweets. :( Well I know for certain that the cake GSS made for our wedding did not meet our standards. I feel bad for writing this review but I just want people to know that they may want to reconsider ordering their wedding cake from GSS even if it comes with their wedding package. 

Luckily I ordered a surprise grooms' cake from Peridot Sweets which was very moist, delicious and worth paying for!

I've had their giant macaron and their cardamom cheesecake! I love that they try to create unique flavors like such . It was okay but nothing to crave for. BUT the macaron was great ! Oh so perfectly chewy and HUGE! And only for $3.50!' Good deal '

This is the first dessert place that I can honestly give a super strong 5 stars to.  So good.  I have been there a handful of times... Every time I go, the desserts are decadent, amazing, divine.  I could go on and on about what I ate but honestly, you have to eat them to understand.  

Just a note: I am a chocoholic so most everything I have ordered has been chocolate.  That being said, their caramel is crazy good.  They make it themselves and if you can find something with caramel on it, I would recommend it.  They know what they are doing and actually put out amazing desserts.  The service is fantastic, too.  The nice lady behind the counter actually remembered me and made reference to what I had ordered before.  

Hope they stay in business for a long time... at least as long as I live in the area!

I think the shop itself is modern and nice and the pastries are good as well. I'm a sucker for their chocolate chip cookies. Unfortunately, they don't always have a huge variety of pastries. They have pretty good macarons though! (I love the fig and goat cheese one!!) The only down side is that their pastries are kind of pricey.

Every time I come to Henderson I try to visit this place. We got a strawberry lemonade and pistachio macaroon. We also got a chocolate, bananas and marshmallow eclair. I have to say everything was so delicious. The shoppe was decorated so classy and the staff was friendly. We will be coming back again.

Stopped in to see my friend's new shop. Sampled the custard chocolate Cronut, which is croissant dough fried up like a donut. It was incredible. Frosting was perfect - not overly sweet and it tasted like good chocolate; not poor quality chocolate made from confection sugar. Also, sampled the sweet bread rolls - bigger and better than King's. Stop by for a pastry, coffee, a custom cake, or even wine/beer.

I ordered a cake for a friend's birthday and really wanted to make it special.  (all on short notice btw).  I gave them some general parameters and left it in their hands.  I was surprised and delighted with what they created- it was not only beautiful, detailed, and had correct proportions-- it was way bigger than I expected!  The cake was dense and moist, and the filling was rich, luxurious and full of flavor.  I will definitely order another cake from them- and no, they are not exactly cheap, but neither are any other 'famous' bakeries in town, which i have also ordered from - and I fully believe in 'you get what you pay for'.  Totally worth it- and i just learned that they have a full open bakery now so I'm going to hit them up for pastries and holiday goodies next.  I'm not baking this year!!

When I was looking for a unique Coffee and pastry shop..definitely this place drew me in with beautifully decorated space. But that's all! I got the Decaf Americano coffee and tiramisu (which is one of my fav desserts). The lady did not make me a decaf which I can tell. I started feeling jittery. Wasn't too impressed with the taste. The tiramisu was ok. It had a funny after taste to me. When going to a specialty place...the items they serve should be better because you're paying extra for that. I prob won't go in there again. I didn't feel warm and fuzzy. Instead i felt cold and unfriendly.   I was going to give 2 stars but gave it 3 because of how beautifully the place was decorated.

We purchased our cake from Gimme Some Sugar and were satisfied with the results. 

The cake was stunning and exceed our expectations. The number of choices available for which cake and combinations you can have in regards to flavors and colors is awesome. 

The taste testing left us with some very difficult choices to make because we wanted all of them. 

Almost everything was perfect, we had two cake choices, red velvet and cookies & cream. 

The only thing that didn't exceed expectations was that numerous guests told us that the red velvet cake did not taste right. At first we thought it was only the drunk guests that felt this way, but then we tried it ourselves and a few sober people said the same thing. Tasted like something was off or missing, it did not taste like the red velvet we tried during the taste testing. We ended up throwing away most of the red velvet. 

Had this been the case for both cakes, we'd have had an issue, but the other cake was perfect and greatly received. We're sure it's not something that happens often and the wedding was awesome so we didn't complain about it because stuff happens. 

We would choose these guys again.
I got a red velvet cupcake. It's the worst cupcake that I've ever had. Cake was very stale and dry. Icing was waxy- after one bite I threw it away. I'm so upset I spent $3.50 for nothing.

Super cute inside! A little pricey but what you pay for for fancy treats!  Cookies were soft and yummy!  Service was great, the gal that helped us was super helpful and nice!

Will definitely be back to take the rest of the family.  Cute place to take girlfriends.  They have a reverse happy hour for a dessert and drink for $14.

And if you order a cookie with ice cream they bake one fresh!

This bakery is near my home, so I finally decided to stop in and try it.  The products look beautiful, and the staff was very helpful and friendly.  That is the end of what was positive.  There were very few of any one item, so I decided to choose two of this and two of that.  Here are the comments from my friends and family.  The cake pop was under done, cookie tasted like baking powder, carrot cake was dry, and the kronuts were tasteless and not real kronuts.  No one even wanted to sample the remaining items, and they will, unfortunately, go in the trash after spending close to $50.   I rarely buy pastries, so when I do, I'd like to enjoy it.  Local supermarkets have better pastries at a fraction of the price.  Needless to say, I won't return to Gimme Some Sugar, and I'm still perplexed at how they received a "Best of Las Vegas" award.

Gave this place a try today. My daughter had the Nutella macaroon and I had the peanut butter blondie. The macaroon was a five, but the blondie was really dry. Good flavor though. I would still recommend this place and will be back to try something else. Everyone has a bad blondie day every now and then, right?

Wanted something extra special for our daughter's 3rd birthday party. Went into the store to ask about a custom order and the woman behind the counter acted like I was bothering her. Was willing to spend good money, we got our girl a pony for her friends to ride on for crying out loud, but this woman was so off putting. Took my business elsewhere.

I remembered this place being so friendly and having beautiful cakes on the walls. Not the place it once was.

I was super excited to try Gimme Some Sugar  because they bake two of my true loves - macaroons and cupcakes. When I got to the store, the only lady working was on the phone. She didn't acknowledge me or anything, and left me waiting for at least 3 minutes. I wanted to try a couple of cupcakes before I ordered a bunch for a baby shower I'm hosting. All they had on hand was vanilla and Nutella. I ordered both flavors and also got a thin mint macaroon. 

I ate the macaroon immediately. It was super sweet. It didn't have an amazing filling.. it was just buttercream and maybe ganache. There was also a thin mint inside, which was cool.

The cupcakes were consumed later by myself and three of my friends. They were awful. Dry and dull. There was no hint on Nutella in the Nutella cupcake. The frosting was overly sweet. I definitely don't recommend these guys for cupcakes. Maybe they do cake better?

Bad service combined with grocery store products - I won't be back.

It's a nice place to visit. The sweets are a little too sweet but still enjoyed it. Pastries on my scale are a 2 out of 10. Would I go back? Yeah maybe for just coffee. Love the idea of the place but I myself enjoy balances sweets. Just my opinion. Keep on working hard!

I've ordered several cakes from Gimme Some Sugar and have not been disappointed! The latest was my daughters baby shower cake; it was elegant and exactly what she wanted. They even molded a beautiful sleeping baby on the top of the cake - everyone was taking pictures. They couldn't get over how beautiful it was. I initially found them after emailing 5 bakeries - they answered immediately - and did exactly what we wanted. I was receiving responses from the other bakeries 2 days later! Ashley at Gimme Some Sugar always responds immediately and I've given her some challenges and she's met every one. Most importantly, the orders were ready on time, looked incredible and tasted awesome. I'd highly recommend!!!!
I used to love this place. Idk what happened. If it is new ownership they have a lot to learn

Was really excited to try this place, attempted to go on Saturday. Yelp says the place is open until 10pm on Saturdays, and we arrived 9pm. There were no lights on, and the sign was off, and their sign says they are open until 10pm. Would have loved to try the place, but their hours are apparently a lie.

First off, I'm a big sweet tooth addict you name it I love it all! 

I started following this bakery on IG even before I moved here and I knew I would get around to it eventually since it is close to our house and I can't go very long without some type of sugar in my life!

Maybe coming in on Christmas Eve (early afternoon) wasn't great since the product was not up to par at all. When we first walked in we saw the pretty dcor and wondered if that was a coverup for subpar product (reminds of Casey's Cupcakes, beautiful on the inside but the product doesn't live up to the dcor)

We were greeted by a nice employee however, there was another employee that totally ignored us and went into the back. Way to make a good first impression on new customers?!

I mainly came into the bakery since I saw on IG they had Gingerbread cookies and my mom had been craving them for such a long time, we saw the cupcakes and ordered one of each ( vanilla/confetti and carrot) I also ordered a snickerdoodle cookie.

Two cupcakes, 2 gingerbread cookies and one snickerdoodle cookie for $12.00 meh typical pricing. I don't ever complain when it comes to the price except when the product isn't good. The saving grace were the cookies, they were delicious and super soft! 

I didn't like how the employee put our cookies in the same carton as the cupcakes, by the time we got home they were messed up :/ Most places have a special holder  for the cupcakes and separate other goodies from the cupcakes.

The presentation of the vanilla cupcake was lame, it reminded me of a box cake mix and tasted like it too, I didn't feel it was homemade, I didn't taste any vanilla, just the confetti. The cake was dry and the icing was just OK. I didn't try the carrot one but my mom said the same thing, it was lacking flavor. 

Maybe this bakers weren't on their A- game since it was Christmas Eve but it just wouldn't be enough to bring me back again.

:/

This business is extremely unprofessional! I purchased three dozen cupcakes for my daughter in laws baby shower. Paid for my order on May 7th the party was May 14th when I arrived to pick up my order. The business was closed with a notice stating the locks were changed for non payment of back rent. Needless to say I was extremely upset because this establishment was locked out two days after I paid for my order. I did not receive a phone call, text or email. That they would not be able to fulfill my order. Proceed with caution if you are going to work with this bakery.

Gimme Some Sugar has opened a dessert bar/bakery in Henderson.  It was opening day and the baked goods and treats were ready.  The place appears to serve desserts, coffee, and wine (not sandwiches/bread).  They don't open very early (11:00 am) and stay open up into the evening.  It would be a nice place for a casual date, conversation with friends, or an after movie/theatre/church snack. The owners might have come up with a nice niche for their business and hopefully it works because the desserts appear awesome.

The  service was very friendly and the pastry I  had (chocolate brownie/chocolate chip cookie) were really yummy.  The pastry looked like super quality stuff and from what I saw prices ranged from about $3 for cookies/brownies to $4 for very unique macarons to about $7 for very high-end cake desserts.  The more pricey desserts looked big enough to share with a date, spouse, or significant other.

The shop has about ten tables and is nicely decorated and clean.  It has a classy-artsy-bistro feel but is mellow with cool music.  It's tucked away in the corner of a strip mall at 215 and Stephanie, but it is not hard to find.

When in the mood for great dessert, this is the place. The great part is a majority of their desserts are Gluten free. If undecided on what to get, you cannot go wrong with any of the macaroons, they are the best in town!!!!! Also the cakes that they are designing are out of this world. And don't be scared of the vegan chocolate chip cookie it is amazing. Everything is fresh and no preservatives, so don't be mad if they sell out of something and don't have back ups. Also they carry a large selection of wines. High quality, great taste, can't go wrong.

Did they strategically place their shop in the same vicinity as a gym? if so, BRILLIANT!

Even if they were miles away from any type of calorie burning facility, I'd gladly visit this place to acquire their luscious sweets (and maybe a few extra lbs).

I've visited this place 4 times so far and have tried mini cheesecakes, dirt cups, tiramisu, monster cookies, macarons, blondies, and decorated sugar cookies. Nothing has been disappointing.

The dcor just adds to the giddy feeling you get when you walk in. Your senses are dazzled by the smells, sights and tastes. The gals behind the counter are always friendly and patient. 

I have never tried their special occasion cakes but there are sample cakes that are shelved throughout their store, and they look absolutely beautiful.

Love this place and can't wait to coordinate a girls night to try dessert and wine pairings! Best part-they're open late!

Do I give it 3 stars? Do I give it 4? Usually if I can't decide I go with the lesser until they have proven me wrong. I think eventually I will up this review a star. But based on my first experience we will start with average. 
All of my yelp friends always talk about this place, check in, post pics, and its so close to me house! Finally after work one night I had a sweet tooth and stopped in. 
Off top, 5 stars for dcor and customer service. I love the old school classy barber shop, winery, ladies saloon style all in one. I was instantly greeted with a smile and a hello. Lighting was dim, but appropriate. 
I was instantly drawn to the berry mascarpone cake. 2 of my favorites in one. $7 for a small piece, I was disappointed. Not enough mascarpone and it was like a berry gelatin. Not bad, but not what I expected. 
I took home, chocolate covered strawberries (3 for $6, decent), cookies, macaroons, and a couple other randoms. Prices were ok. 
I could imagine myself loving this place and enjoying a glass of wine n cupcake after work entirely to often. Who's my first yelp date down for drinks and desserts?! Jessie B? Shirley B?

After going to the gym next door, I decided to stop by Gimme Some Sugar (set back my workout progress but so worth it!) and did not regret that decision.  I ordered the tiramisu cake at $5 for a cup of it.  Most tiramisu that I've tried have a very moist texture similar to tres leches cake, but the tiramisu here was much more light and airy, and it was delicious.

I love the atmosphere of the bakery too.  The furniture and decor look very upscale, and the bakery still feels welcoming at the same time.  Customer service is top notch too.  It was cool to look at the many custom cake displays set out throughout the bakery.  

I came back to Gimme Some Sugar today, and tried the large thin mint macaron, at the recommendation of the lady at the counter.  The macaron was the size of burger buns and reasonably priced at $4.95 for such a huge piece.  This macaron was amazing!  The taste was very similar to thin mint cookies, and there were real thin mint pieces inside with the cream filling.  The texture of the cookies was great and the cookies were not hollow, unlike many other macarons I've tried in the past.

So now the director of operations emails me to email her about my review. My point was this less than mediocre rating bake shoppe has zero personal attention when it comes  to the customer and she proved it. Just read her response to the review and the snapshot of her response to me. Lol! It's ok director! My daughters birthday cake was ordered and discussed personally with someone right on the bake shoppe premises that I went to.The bake shoppe is Showboy in Anthem and they earned my business the right way. Personal service is the way to earn business when it comes to this industry. The reason why your place is dead all the time is because ether incompetent people working there and just quite possibly your lack of caring. I am in constant contact with media and people who can give you plenty of business, FYI I will never ever recommend this place ever. You'll be closed soon...
They did our custom Harley wedding cake way back in 2009 and most recently a birthday cake. The skill level is AMAZING and the cake itself is super moist and delicious. Highly recommend!

Went to this business a few months ago for a cake and was really delicious done a great job and hit the nail on the head with the design of the cake as well as the flavor and was also done on time for my birthday party for my little girl cake tasted amazing went back there again today for some cookies and cake pops and they were amazing of course will definitely recommend this company to all my friends

I kept seeing this place coming out of the gym (dangerous place to put a bakery), and was curious. I love baked goods, so trust me when I say I had to stop myself from going multiple times. I was doing a small party for a friend, and finally had a reason to go in and see what was up.

First off, this place is adorable. Very creative cakes all around, clean, and just a general good vibe. There wasn't any customers, and one staff. I told her that I wanted to order some desserts for a small party in a couple weeks. She was very helpful and told me about all the different desserts they had. I ended up choosing a little bit of almost everything, which she wrote on an order form, and I was on my way.

Fast forward two weeks, and I come in to pick up my order. The same girl is working, and she informs me that somehow, someone took the order form she had made, and threw it away. Hm, okay. Well, I'll just pick from what's in the display case, it can't be too different. I honestly don't remember each thing I ordered, but I do remember that some of them were no longer in the case. Bummer.

Overall, the consensus at the party was that they were all a little too sweet. That may be a taste preference, but when my husband (who inhales candy and soda) says the macaroon was too sweet, that's saying something. I can only rate the desserts I had (mini cheesecake, chocolate ganache, mini tarts, some kind of passion fruit thing, macaroons, cake pops), not their cakes or other items. 

For the high price, and the "hype" on yelp, I guess I expected more. I may come back if I need a beautiful cake, but probably not for their dessert case items.

This place is so impressive.  All of the desserts look like a work of art, and they taste fantastic.  Lots of interesting flavor combinations with the cupcakes and macarons.  The coffee is REALLY good, and the service is great, too.  I recommend them for any occasion!

Love this place! My new go to for any cupcake/cake order. 

Asked for a very specifically decorated cake and cupcakes for my son's 24th birthday. Not only did they hit it out of the park with the decorations but the flavors were out of this world. Banana Peanut butter and Butterfinger. 

Will go back as often as I can make a reason to.

Gimme some sugar, gimme some artificial tasting frosting and then gimme my tooth brush. 

Sorry to be the buzz kill of the group, but I'm not loving what I had here. We ordered 3 different macarons, Nutella, Maple-Bacon and Late Night Snack. The first bite of each, all I could think of was how artificial it tasted. It tasted like someone had stuffed store bought cake frosting in between the macarons. I took a bite of each and couldn't finish any of them. 

The rest of their dessert cake wasn't that appealing. They had inidividual size treats, like dirt cake and the such, but each costing around $6? Gimme (no pun intended) a break. Way overpriced on all of their desserts here. Would much rather spend my money and calories elsewhere.

Super cute, super girly, I like it. 

I have to say I'm a dessert person, so I was really excited to try this spot. The ladies working here are so nice. They offer suggestions and don't mind our sometimes loud girl chatter. They serve alcohol as well, which is also a plus! 4 stars for the amazing customer service and their wine. 

However, I'm not too fond of their desserts. While the macarons are huge and come in a variety of flavors, it's just way too sweet for me. And the texture is a little off from what I'm used to. I also tried their strawberry & champagne cupcake, which was just eh. The cake was dry, way too much frosting and the strawberry filling was way sweet. I really wanted some water and to brush my teeth after. Their chocolate chip cookie was average and way too oily. The oil had soaked through the paper bag and onto the napkin I placed it on. Needless to say, I've had better baked goods before. 

All in all, I do enjoy this place with my friends when we need some girl time and maybe something sweet. But I wouldn't come here on my own.

Right when I walked in I was amazed at how gorgeous everything looked! Very chic furniture. And they also had gorgeous display cakes along their wall. The worker there told me and my friend that everything the sell there was made right at their store, pretty neat! There was a lot of different kinds of desserts you could choose from cakes to vegan cookies to macarons. And they have GIANT macarons, kinda pricey at $3.50-$4.50 per macaron might I add. My friend just got the Nutella macaron and it was nothing special, not the best macaron I have had but it was still delicious. I got the fig and goat cheese macaron just because it sounded odd to me and I love to try new things. That day I learned I do not like fig... Or goat cheese. The workers were extremely nice and welcoming. Also on Mondays they are only open by appointment only?

If you are a macaroon lover this is the place to be.  I just realized im not really into macaroons but this bakery offers the best I've ever tasted. They are a bit oversized so get ready to indulge in a rich, sweet pastry. I ordered the nutella macaroon, snickerdoodle, thin mint and birthday cake.. the nutella macaroon was very sweet and rich.. nonetheless it was still good. The ambience of this place was gorgeous very girly and sophisticated. Theyre open til midnight so if you wanna lounge with your gals you can do so !

The two stars are honestly because of how good it was last time I was here. However, on Yelp as well as on the door there are hours of operation which say Monday through Thursday 10am to 8pm, Friday and Saturday 10am to 10pm, and closed on Sunday. 

Here I am, parked outside on a Wednesday at 6:50pm. The lights are on, there are desserts in the case that I can see, however the OPEN sign is no longer lit and the door is locked. Honestly, I wouldn't mind it if there was a sign on the door explaining why they are closed for the night, but there is none to be seen. So, if there is clearly hours on the door, I'd advise them to stick to it. 

I guess the next time I decide to come here, I'll call to actually make sure they're open. I would advise those who would like to try their desserts to try, too!
Once again... Simple, Beautiful and Delicious! My wife loved her birthday cake. I wish you could see the sparkles on the cake but unfortunately the Camera could not capture it.

I had a late night craving and my roomie told me about this amazing place that's not to far from our house. Once she mentioned that they had Samoa macaroon's I was SOLD! Upon arrival to the store they have two sides; a merchandise side to swag yourself out in Gimme Some Sugar gear and the bakery side. I arrived 20 minutes till closing and asked the nice lady about the Samoa macaroon's and she told me they were sold out since that morning. I was totally bummed out but then she mentioned a Nutella Macaroon which she gave to me for free. WOW!! That macaroon was amazing! I ended up ordering 5 more to help me satisfy my sugar cravings. All in all I'm a fan and will be back to try their infamous Samoa Macaroon..

This place is so beautiful!  Very chic.  The display cakes are jaw-dropping.  They do cakes for celebrities, so you will not be disappointed in the cake design!

I love the cheesecake and macarons.  They're giant!  My personal favorite was probably the mint chocolate one, the one where they put an entire Girl Scout cookie inside.

They're open very late, so you'll love it if you get a late night sweet craving.  And they serve wine!  Great for a ladies' night out, or date night!

Brenda is super sweet and helpful!

I can't believe I have lived a mile away from Gimme Some Sugar for over three years and never stopped by for a treat. Shame, shame, shame on me.

When I did some research on the "Bake Shoppe" in the shopping center near the 215, I found out it was a well known bakery, so I immediately went to their website and researched whether or not they had gluten free options. On their site they said they had gluten free options, and I saw a couple reviews on Yelp only mentioning their gluten free brownies. However, when I went onto their Facebook page and asked about gluten free options, they immediately replied and told me most of their Macarons are safe for me to eat. I almost immediately jumped into the car and headed over to their shoppe. 

When we got there, we tried their gluten free brownie with nuts and onr Macarons: PB&J. I was worried that the Macaron was going to be too sweet and put me into sugar shock. Not even. Perfectly balanced. Sometimes gluten free baked goods can be dry, overly sweet, grainy and disappointing. When I eat a baked good that tastes like peanut butter and jelly and brings me comfort like only that kind of sandwich I can, I knew everything else was going to be great. Even though the brownie was dense, it was like a delicious flourless chocolate cake with a rich ganache. I coudn't eat it all at once, but that's what made it so delicious. The brownie (since it was huge) lasted me three days which is the way to eat baked goods!

Also, I found out that you can have parties there with friends, wine and pre-ordered Macarons. The shoppe is swanky and classy with just a bit of an edge, and after telling my friends about how delicious everything was we will be planning a fun ladies night there too. 

Stop on by, try the Macarons; they're light, delicious, not painfully sweet and always hit the spot, and I can't wait to stop by there again soon!

Had a Living Social coupon for a dozen cupcakes - got them for wife's birthday.  A small hitch in service was more than made up with great cupcakes and having them delivered.  Had the red velvet cupcakes and were treated to pumpkin spice ones.  Looking forward to trying their cakes.

Call before going... Online it said they were closing at 10 but when I showed up at 6 on a Saturday they were about to lock down the store. The interior is really cute but I think their "cuteness" is trying to compensate for the quality. There wasn't a lot of variety to choose from and I was super bummed out about it. I ordered a single macaroon (because it was all that looked good) which was huge and proved that bigger isn't always better. I would have rather had a smaller cookie with bigger flavor and softer texture but instead got the opposite. The lady behind the counter who seemed pretty nice gave me a free doughnut for being the last customer since they were shutting the doors. It was a typical chocolate creme filled but it looked melted and was messy. I took one bite and it was nothing special. Tasted like a doughnut someone forgot on their dashboard in their car for a few days. Tossed it. I feel like this place has a lot of potential but whoever running it needs to understand looks aren't everything and there's a looot that they need to work on. I wish I had trusted the other reviews. Pretty disappointed.
their product  looks great, but has no flavor!!..way to pricey for what you get...both girls are hard to deal with and have the personality of a tumbleweed!...pass this one up!

I think it's new owners. Not the same....
I asked the woman behind the counter if they were new owners and received a hesitant reply of "same chef" and no confirmation of ownership change. 

All the sample cakes that adorned the store's wall pedestals were gone as well as the framed articles on the wall of the celeb cakes featured in many magazines. 

Macarons did not taste the same, less variety and now selling all sorts of Majestic Bread products

Wouldn't be surprised if name change was forthcoming

Went for the first time today and this place is just sooo cute! It's located off 215/Stephanie in the shopping center that Gold's Gym is in. 
I love that they're open really late, as that's when I get most of my sugar attacks lol. If you look around, you'll see that they have some AMAZING cake designs. They also have a good amount of drink options, coffees and wines yumm.I'll keep updating this everytime I try something new.
