Absolutely amazing. This is honestly the cutest little place ever!!! I took my husband here for dessert on his birthday and he loved it
Absolutely love this place! The macaroons are delicious the ambiance is great and the staff is very nice!!! Definitely recommend when you're craving something sweet.

This place just opened. I stopped in to try based on a news story mentioning they had vegan and gluten free options. Today they only had a gluten free brownie but they expect to have more options in the future. 

My wife had a macaron. She loved it. They have a very good selection with some interesting combinations.

Been coming here for awhile now, and I was also here for a soft opening or grand opening?? The inside and cake displays are amazing and very creative. Definitely worth the drive from the west side NV to Henderson. Thy best opera cake!!! This is the place for good sweets. Here they have a whole stand just for macaroons and cupcakes . Assorted flavor and some seasonal macaroons, there is always something new to try.

As much as I wanted to like this place I just couldn't. They serve stale leftover baked goods... First visit I bought a challah bread, I was a little worried because it was so pale but I had been looking for one for a while so I bought it. Although  the dough wasn't undercooked it tasted like it was raw. 

Second visit, I went to buy a cupcake. The display was dismal at best with only the choice of vanilla or chocolate. Not the variety I would expect from a professional bakery. It looked like scraps from the day before. But I wanted to try their cake as I am looking for a baker for my wedding. When I got home ready to try it I couldn't have been more disappointed. The paper was stiff and stuck hard to the cake, then I tried to cut it in half but instead the cake was so stale it wouldn't cut and just bent. 

I also ordered a tea latte, which the girl taking my order didn't even realize was on their menu. As I waited 10 minutes for them to make my drink, they constantly looked back at the menu trying to figure out how to make it. They asked if I wanted it hot or cold. I said cold. But at the end I got what they intended to be a hot drink, but they poured cold milk into it and I got an unpleasant lukewarm tea instead. 

I can't believe I paid money for this. Walmart has better quality goods then this place.

There has been a lot of attention for this new bakery off of Stephanie and the 215 and I'll quickly chime in to add my experience with them.
We visited the weekend they first opened and things were still new, kinks were still being worked out.  However, I did enjoy that first visit with the tasty pumpkin cheesecake.  
A month later, I ordered a custom birthday cake for good friend, Shirley B., who's a big fan of Gimme Some Sugar.  I e-mailed GSS with my requests for a cake with a Hello Kitty and SF 49er theme because those are two of Shirley B.'s favorite things.  Ashley responded promptly and we coordinated on the details.  The resulting birthday cake was just the thing and the surprised look on Shirley's face when we presented the cake at her birthday dinner was priceless; she loved it.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/gimme-some-sugar-henderson-3?userid=7Oe6ikklTjVBbEFw9emLcA#xMTMOVBqAc0YKsVJaeUGEA
First-rate customer service from the beginning to the end with Ashley and her shop.  That is a rare thing indeed and I give them five stars all the way for filling the order above and beyond.  I'm a fan and we'll definitely be giving GSS more business in the future.

Tried Gimme Some Sugar cause I am a sucker for sweets and anything retro (the decor, mostly). So I stopped in because I heard through the grapevine that they have macarons and they are HUGE.

The grapevine did not disappoint. The macarons look delicious and are seriously large - bigger than the palm of my hand. I was super excited to grab some, so I ordered the mint Girl Scout cookie, the caramel and coconut Girl Scout cookie, a s'mores, a Nutella, and another one I can't remember. I was stoked!

I brought them home, resisting the urge to devour them in the car. I sat down at my table, opened the box, and was smacked in the face with diabetes. Holy crap were they sweet! Now, I have a serious sweet tooth. I love all things dessert, but these had a sickly-sweet over the top taste that was not very pleasing. I would LOVE a good French macaron, but I can't justify spending nearly $3 a piece for these when you can't even eat a whole one before feeling woozy. (And no, I didn't buy the one with booze in it, either).

Now, I didn't try the cakes or desserts in the case, but I would be willing to. I guess the macarons just weren't for me. I will probably be back for some cake though!

After our night at Hot and Juicy, we continued on to have dessert at Gimme Some Sugar! They have a new bake shoppe on Stephanie, just off the 215.  In fact, we were there on their 2nd night open!

They have 2 display cases with yummy desserts and the staff was amazingly friendly!  They are passionate about their products and have something for everyone.  

I am not a huge sweets eater, but I decided to have a glass of wine (yes, they serve alcohol!) with a candy cane macaron.  These macarons are HUGE!  Definitely not like anything I've ever seen!  And it was delicious!  

It is great that they are open late on the weekends, this is a great place to come with friends (or on a date), to grab a drink and a cupcake.

I love supporting local businesses and really hope that this place makes it!  My only complaint is that the prices are a little bit high.  It cost me $14 for the macaron and 1 glass of wine....I understand that these are all hand made items, but the cost may deter some people from going back.  $30 for a dozen cupcakes is a little crazy, in my opinion, even if they are really delicious!

Moved into a new apt down up the street from this place. I have never been here but my 21st birthday cake was from here. It was incredible! So I decided to come to gimme some sugar for a craving. I ordered the apple crisp. I took it to go, heated it up put the vanilla ice cream on top and the pecans. Well the pecans were crushed and candied! How AMAZING, it was to go and tasted so great! It was $10 for my dessert so I won't be able to grab dessert as often as I'd like but it will be a great treat when I do!

Finally decided to drop in GSS. 
My, oh, my...

I~~ want to swing on your chandelier...

Fancy bake shop! They also serve wine and & beer? Wow...tried their Strawberry Beer...awesome! Pumpkin Cake Pop, bomb! Cheese cakes...(@_@) to die for!!!

The staffs greeted us when we came and was patience when we were browsing around looking for what's good to nom nom on. 

Def be back to try out other flavors of their cheese cake. I'm a huge sucker for cheese cake. 

One day I would to place an order for a custom cake from them. 

Would recommend to Friends and Family.
My go to place especially when I have a major sweet tooth moment. I usually come here on my way to work or after work. I love love their hot chocolate & the Nutella macaroons.

They did an amazing job on a cake I ordered for my husband's birthday last year (I know this review is long over due). I ordered an exact replica of the Kellogg's Frosted Flakes cereal box and came to GSS because they're notorious for their cakes. They do all the big celebrity cakes for nightclub appearances and more. I knew they would do a great job but I was shocked at how close to the actual cereal box the cake looked. Their work is very clean! They even placed the cake on a nicely decorated display board. For the flavor I chose the cookies n' cream and it was better when it was room temperature then straight out of the fridge. I love how the cake was dense but do wish it was more moist and rich.

I have never tried a Macaroon because they are usually with Coconut...which I'm not a fan of. HOWEVER, our first visit here today changed my mind forever!! Peanut Butter Chocolate Macaroon....END if story!! Wow!! Amazing!

I wish I got the girls name that helped us because she was amazing!!we got 3 macarons strawberry lemonade...gauva..and birthday cake...YUMMM to ALL 3. My youngest couldn't decide and wanted something from the gas station around the corner instead!!! Lmaoo...the girl that worked there gave her a birthday cake macaron to try(wich she didn't like...crazy kid!!)so me and my other daughter split hers lol and took her to gas station and she was happy as all could be getting 2 bags of smarties!!!

Well, I wish I could rate the desserts here. Unfortunately when we arrived after dinner,  about 7:00 PM they were sold out of almost everything. Just a couple of small $2.50 cupcakes that looked to be out all day and some macarons left. I was craving a red velvet cupcake or chocolate cake but it was not meant to be. The display case was practically empty so we left. Not sure if they just didn't make enough or maybe it was a busy day??

I have to say that Gimme some sugar is decorated very cute and looks like it could be a great place to hang out.  They do have beers, wine and bubbly to partake in and that is a great highlight.

I'm going to preface this by saying that the ladies who were working the evening that we went were very interested in our opinion on what we thought about the baked goodies.  I had the rice krispy bar and my hubby had the tiramisu.  The rice krispy bar was good but nothing to write home about, the chocolate was a nice touch.  My hubby had the tiramisu.  The bottom half was the best part.  One of the ladies, actually took the parts that were not eaten to show to the chef as where they could improve. 

I'll need to give this place another shot in the future.  They are quite a few more items to try and from what I hear from others they are worth trying!

In the area and craving a sweet I decided to check my bookmarks and lo and behold Gimme Some Sugar popped up on my Yelp app bookmarks. 

Having heard some good reviews from trusted Yelpers I was excited to give them a try. I walked in and the place is super cute. Clean and well-decorated. I was greeted warmly by the three girls working at the counter. They were ready for any questions and had plenty of suggestions for me while I perished their inventory. I had my heart set on a macaron and they are huge. Interesting flavors as well. I decided on the fig & goat cheese and the maple bacon. I also had some questions on some pricing for specialty cakes and towers and they were very helpful and assisted me with all my questions and gave me lots of information and contact information if I decided to order something for the future. 

The macarons were flaky and moist. I didn't love the flavors, but they were ok. I took a few bites and didn't really feel the need to finish them. I'd be back if I'm in the area to see what else they have to offer.

I went in awhile ago to see what this shop had since I LOVE to bake & am always eager to support my local bakeries. I didnt even get a chance to try the goodies because I was so turned off by the staff. The lady behind the counter seemed like she had an attitude, but hey, maybe I came on an off day. Since I have worked my fair share of customer service jobs I know it can be hard to always be cheerful, but I ended up leaving afterwards. I gave them 3 stars because I would like to come back & actually enjoy the goods. They have great reviews and ill update this when I get a chance to try it again. Im hoping I just came on an off day & that the employees aren't actually that rude.
